spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sorcerer's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 14}, {@hit +6}). The sorcerer can cast the following spells innately.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sorcerer is a 4th-level spellcaster. It's spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 14}, {@hit +6}). It knows the following sorcerer spells.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the
sorcerer can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a
{@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the
sorcerer; the sorcerer then disappears, and the target is
{@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The sorcerer
now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of
awareness. While doing so, the sorcerer is considered
to be undead. The sorcerer can't be targeted by any
attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn
undead, and it retains its alignment and its Intelligence,
Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It otherwise uses the
possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to
the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points,
the sorcerer ends it as a bonus action, or the sorcerer is
forced out by an effect like the dispel good and evil
spell. When the possession ends, the sorcerer
reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the
body. The target is immune to the sorcerer's Possession
for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or
after the possession ends.

trait.name: Morbid Weapons
entries: The priest's weapon attacks are magical. When the priest hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Mastery of Death (3/Day)
entries: When the researcher is reduced to 0 hit points and not killed outright, it can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the researcher isn't wearing armor, its armor class includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The researcher makes two attacks with its Death Strike.

action.name: Death Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage. If the damage from this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the researcher gains 13 ({@dice 2d10 + 2}) temporary hit points.

action.name: Empty Face (Research 5-6)
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the researcher that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} by it until the end of the researcher's next turn.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The assassin has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it has surprised.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 25/100, one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

trait.name: Loyal Goons
entries: When the mastermind is targeted by an attack and an ally is within 5 feet of it, the mastermind's ally can use its reaction to swap places with the mastermind, and the ally becomes the target instead.

trait.name: Master of Tactics
entries: The mastermind can use the Help action as a bonus action. When used to assist an ally in attacking a creature, the target of the attack can be within 30 feet of the mastermind.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The mastermind deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the mastermind that isn't incapacitated and the mastermind doesn't
have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Soul of Deceit
entries: The mastermind's thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means. The mastermind can present false thoughts by succeeding on a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the mind reader's Wisdom (Insight) check. Additionally, the mastermind is unaffected by magic that would compel it to tell the truth; instead, such magic always indicates that the mastermind is truthful.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 or range 20/60, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mercenary makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Shadow Pact
entries: The rogue casts no shadow. It has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in dim light or darkness. Its shadow, represented by the shadow statblock, has a mental connection with the rogue while they are within 500 feet of each other. Within this range, they have two-way telepathy. Additionally, as a bonus action, they can teleport to the other's location as long as they are both on the same plane of existence. They also share the Black Eyes action.

trait.name: Shadowy Magic
entries: The rogue and the shadow share the same innate spellcasting abilities, drawing from the same pool of available spells. Spells unavailable to the rogue also become unavailable to the shadow, and vice versa. Their shared innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 10}, {@hit 2} to hit with spell attacks). They can cast the following spells.
At will: chill touch, dancing lights, thaumaturgy
6/day: darkness, fog cloud, misty step, sleep
3/day: invisibility, pass without trace
1/day: hunger of Hadar

trait.name: Shadowy Resurrection
entries: If the rogue or the shadow are killed, a member of the pair that is still alive can spend 1 hour to resurrect the other as long as 30 days have not passed. If the rogue leaves behind a body, it
disintegrates. The resurrected reappears within 5 feet
of the resurrector.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 or range 20/60, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. The rogue deals an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage if it has advantage on the attack roll or if its shadow is within 5 feet of the target and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Black Eyes
entries: The rogue becomes blind and deaf through its own senses and instead sees and hears through the senses of the shadow, or vice versa. Either the rogue or the shadow can end this effect as an action.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sorcerer's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When the sorcerer drops to 0 hit points and isn't killed outright, it can instead drop to 1 hit point and cast gaseous form on itself without expending a spell slot or components. If it can't cast this spell, it drops to 0 hit points as usual.

trait.name: Partial Regeneration
entries: The sorcerer gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If it starts its turn in sunlight or running water, it gains 5 temporary hit points instead, replacing any temporary hit points it might have gained through other sources. This trait doesn't function if the sorcerer is prevented from regaining hit points on its turn, such as through the chill touch spell.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The sorcerer can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or back into its true form. While in bat form, the sorcerer can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sorcerer makes two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5, one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the sorcerer can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Blood Pact
entries: The Hemomancer can reduce its hit points by 5 to cast a spell of first level without expending a spell slot. t can cast spells at higher level using this trait, but it must expend an additional 5 hit points for each level of the spell above 1st.

trait.name: Deepen Wound
entries: When the Hemomancer hits a creature that is below its hit point maximum with a spell, the creature takes an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

Necromancers are specialist wizards who study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some like to dig up corpses to create undead slaves. A few use their powers for good, becoming hunters of the undead and risking their lives to save others.

{@bold Hemomancers.} Hemomancers, quite similar to Necromancers, are specialist spell casters controlling the machinations of death and undeath. However their power source is more close to that of a Warlock, created from a bond with a powerful commander of life and death, such as a powerful Lich, or a god of death, that allows them to use dark ritualistic forms of magic. Their power can be called upon with normal means which is often limited, or by sacrificing their own vitality, limited only by their body's health.
